1.text: Not unto us, O LORD, not unto us, but unto thy name give glory, for thy mercy, and for thy truth's sake.

2.text: Wherefore should the heathen say, Where is now their God?

3.text: But our God is in the heavens: he hath done whatsoever he hath pleased.

4.text: Their idols are silver and gold, the work of men's hands.

5.text: They have mouths, but they speak not: eyes have they, but they see not:

6.text: They have ears, but they hear not: noses have they, but they smell not:

7.text: They have hands, but they handle not: feet have they, but they walk not: neither speak they through their throat.

8.text: They that make them are like unto them; so is every one that trusteth in them.

9.text: O Israel, trust thou in the LORD: he is their help and their shield.

10.text: O house of Aaron, trust in the LORD: he is their help and their shield.

11.text: Ye that fear the LORD, trust in the LORD: he is their help and their shield.

12.text: The LORD hath been mindful of us: he will bless us; he will bless the house of Israel; he will bless the house of Aaron.

13.text: He will bless them that fear the LORD, both small and great.

14.text: The LORD shall increase you more and more, you and your children.

15.text: Ye are blessed of the LORD which made heaven and earth.

16.text: The heaven, even the heavens, are the LORD'S: but the earth hath he given to the children of men.

17.text: The dead praise not the LORD, neither any that go down into silence.

18.text: But we will bless the LORD from this time forth and for evermore. Praise the LORD.
